casebody.data:
Charles H. CHILDS, Jr. and Earl P. Paris, Plaintiffs-Appellants, v. RIC GROUP, INC., Defendant-Appellee. W. Wyman PILCHER et al., Plaintiffs-Appellees, v. Earl P. PARIS, Jr., et al., Defendants-Appellants. No. 71-1012. United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Oct. 12, 1971. John W. Chambers, Atlanta, Ga., for plaintiffs-appellants. Byrd, Groover, & Buford, Garland T. Byrd, Macon, Ga., Hugh M. Dorsey, Jr., Atlanta, Ga., for RIC Group, Inc.

Before WISDOM, COLEMAN and SIMPSON, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

Assigning written reasons, the district judge granted summary judgment1 against the plaintiffs-appellants, Childs and Paris. They have failed to demonstrate error in that judgment on this appeal.

Affirmed.

. Reported as Childs and Paris v. RIC Group, Inc., N.D.Ga.1970, 331 F.Supp. 1078.
